website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you like the idea of a combination square with extra functions; but keep in mind it may take you a while to master it.
pros: In addition to the square head, it comes with a protractor head for added versatility
Offers a high degree of accurate measurements with easy-to-read increments
cons: Has a learning curve, and the instructions aren't very clear
Not quite as durable as higher-priced squares

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate because of poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that it came pretty fast. But I didn't like the fact that it was machined wrong. It was not accurate at all. Lots of burrs. Only one side of the indicator could be set on zero, and once there, the protractor was out by a 16th in 12 inches. The square was out by at least a 64th in 12 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Out of square, twice.
customer_reviews.text: Did my homework between Starrett and iGaging, felt it was worth the shot as many reviews said the iGaging was comparable for a fraction of the cost. Received my first iGaging combination square set and did a "Line test" to check for square, it failed miserably. Gave them the benefit of the doubt and requested an exchange. 2nd combo square also failed albeit by a smaller margin, still unacceptable. I'll pay the same money and get a single head Starrett and buy the other heads over time. A square isn't worth a darn if it ain't square.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Gryctz

customer_reviews.title: The 4" square has some spots where their grinders missed due to poor casting quality but overall it functions
customer_reviews.text: With any knockoff manufacturer there's always that dice roll when you buy from them. Personally I've got a 4" square and this 12" combination square from iGaging. The 4" square has some spots where their grinders missed due to poor casting quality but overall it functions. Reads square with my other starrett square (6"). This item was better than the 4" square but its still no starrett. Even so I still reach for it regularly as its heads and shoulders better than the other knocks I've used and is better than the Irwin combination square. Just be aware that the quality of the item you receive, as is evident by some of these other reviews, may be dramatically different.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: anyone that has ever used one of these tools should be able to do that easily. Overall this is an excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is made well. I checked the calibration and foun no issues. Comments I've seen about mounting the accessories (hard to do for some) was unfounded, anyone that has ever used one of these tools should be able to do that easily. Overall this is an excellent tool... I think I'll make a wooden case for it though ( even though presently I use it so much it is never in the box). I would have paid more for this if it had a box, the one that came with it is marginal at best.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley D Lantz

customer_reviews.title: Good budget combination square
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything for the accuracy of the protractor head on it but the center finder and the square are dead on with accuracy. I checked both to reference gauges at work and they are both perfect. I don't have the equipment to check the accuracy of the protractor but it is at least far better than anything you can find in the hardware store I bet. The included certification sheet provides the included accuracy and all so if anything is wrong with it you should be able to send it back to have it fixed so they could be held accountable for any bad tolerances or what have you.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy fit
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I finally shelled out for a combination square that I had hopes was better than those from the big box store. As they say, the 'cheapskate' ends up paying WAY more for his goods than a wise one, due to the frequent replacement. I know have three different poor grade tools and have spent more than enough to purchase the good one. Which I will now have to do anyway. This thing wiggles around plus the scribe piece does not have a positive housing. Fergetaboutit.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Aeronaught

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this comb. square and it is the best square I've ever had. Very sturdy and very nicely made. Quite a nice square for the money, very good buy and it is about 1/3 to 1/4 the cost of others that I've had and it is a much nicer tool. Like I have stated it is very heavy and nicely ground and marked. If you need a good comb.square this is the one to buy but if you should just need one for around the house try a Stanley and save yourself some money.The packaging for shipping was good and it comes in a nice plastic case.
customer_reviews.author: RDM

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price and the material feels solid. The square is not a true 90 deg. since there is some play between the blade and head, even when tightened down. I just use my older square and carpenter's square for accuracy and use this for the odd angles I need to work with around the house.
customer_reviews.author: rlb

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: First things first. It's not a Starrett. The mechanical components feel CHEAP. I don't think that it's good for more than a couple of years. That being said, I've checked the heads and scale against machinist's equipment and it's all true. The scale is easy to read. If you want to buy the last set you'll ever buy, spend about $200 more. This does really good in a bind though.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: A very useful addition to my tool box.
customer_reviews.text: Got it for some fence repairs, and it was truly good to have. I had no worries about its accuracy, but then repeatability and transferability of angles were all I needed. I had no immediate need to use the center finder but was really happy to have it when I needed to drill a center hole on the clapper for a wind chime.
customer_reviews.author: Alan P

customer_reviews.title: Everything slides and works pretty easy. Comes with case and everything
customer_reviews.text: Everything slides and works pretty easy. Comes with case and everything. The only think you will see wrong with this item is the fit and finish when you put it next to a Starret. If you are not a Machinist for a living buy this.
customer_reviews.author: AZonPrimeTimePaddy

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: I have a Starett combo square my Dad gave which is probably 70 years old and it was time to retire that heirloom. For my use this set is accurate, durable,easy to read and operate. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Good square
customer_reviews.text: As with all types of tools, as long as you know what you are doing you should have no trouble with this unit. I found it to be quite accurate and well-made. Operates smoothly and is easy to change out the toolheads, no different than any other combo square I have used. I think it is a good buy, definitely a few steps above the usual Chinese imports. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accuacy
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I purchase a very cost effective combo square. But it is difficult to set the square at a precise measurement. The Igaging is right on.
customer_reviews.author: gtt

customer_reviews.title: It was NOT square.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this combination square. The one thing a square needs to be is SQUARE. This one was not. A simple test drawing a line from an edge and reversing the square to draw another line showed it was off noticeably. I’ve had cheap squares bought at big-box stores that were more accurate. I have since purchased a Starrett, which while more expensive, is not only accurate but the action is much smoother as well.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C.

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be a very good tool
customer_reviews.text: More entry level tools for the grandsons to learn with, Stumpy Nubs, you tube, rated them good, far less expensive to start with and seem to be very good quality tool with a case.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, quality built combo square set!
customer_reviews.text: These things are heavy duty! They do need calibrated (easy to do, check YouTube), but they are quality tools at an affordable price that I will use for a long time to come. Better than Harbor Freight quality, if that's what you're wondering 👍
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: Well made and a remarkable value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Super value for a fairly decent combination square. It's not machined to the fine tolerances of elite devices, but it makes a great shop tool for general use. Certainly worth the price. I definitely recommend this combination square.
customer_reviews.author: Tod Prosa

customer_reviews.title: It's not a Starrett, but it has a quality ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not a Starrett, but it has a quality rule and the protractor is easier to read than most. Accurate too.
customer_reviews.author: Hacker

customer_reviews.title: works great, i love the casr
customer_reviews.text: Looks gook, works great,i love the casr, it lacks a handle but that might get in the way anyway. I just hate to give five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool, very well built.
customer_reviews.text: Thes set is very accurate, I was pleased with the tool overall. Did not expect that level of quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey White

customer_reviews.title: “This did everything I wanted it to.”
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for trimming out a round window. This is a beautiful tool. Sturdy. Came in a nice case.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy10

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be calibrated.
customer_reviews.text: Product was only eyeballed in and needs calibration. Do not expect to be able to use this tool with any accuracy straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Starrett for $250. iGaging for less than 20% of that. My dimensioning has greatly improved my joinery. Much less planing and sanding to make joints flush and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, a little pricey but I guess it's okay compared to a starrett.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product no problems makes it worth buying instead of starret
customer_reviews.author: Rick moye

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Good quality except centering tool is off by an 1/8”
customer_reviews.author: shipmag

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this set! So much so I bought the 24" set also! Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Zack Lookenott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's not a sterret but for the price it's great
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The square is accurate. The center is handy but ...
customer_reviews.text: The square is accurate. The center is handy but the scale on the protractor is too small to accurately set to desired angle.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Accuratate
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate tool. Will purchase iGaging in the future. I measured with a machinist square and it measured the same thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Warlock

customer_reviews.title: average
customer_reviews.text: If I had more money I would get the starett, I don't so this is the best I can do. It is temperamental at best, it does the job but I just know there are better designs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and exspense
customer_reviews.text: Item I received had a ruler that looked like it had been abused. It was so rough that the pieces did not slide smoothley and the center finder would jam as you tried to slide it. Also one of the latches on the case did not work. Decided to return it and pay for the shipping?
customer_reviews.author: Marshall D. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great for people and jobs that are hard on their tools compared to more expensive brands
customer_reviews.text: Great price, very durable. Takes a bit to get your heads on but not worth complaining about
customer_reviews.author: bman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good unit after I filed off the rough edges of the blade & lock bolt.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Killer deal on a  great combination set.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very critical of tools, but I really cannot find fault in this combination set. It's an exceptional value and even if you're used to $250+ squares you won't be disappointed. This is the 3rd tool I've purchased from Anytime Tools and have been highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: GravityDefiant

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Clean, clear markings pieces fit together well. Serving it's function well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not great at all
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty rule, which is a plus, but some of the parts are a bit abrasive and not milled smoothly. Thumbscrews have rough feel. Cut-through on 45 degree piece is poor. Paid $52 + 5.99 ship and have to ship back at own expense which would cost another $6-7. Guess you get what you pay for, except that I feel that I could have gotten one like this at a cheaper price. Should have opted for a Starrett, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: ACT

customer_reviews.title: (Un)happy owner of a defective unit!!
customer_reviews.text: The iGaging Premium 4-Piece 12" 4R Combination Square arrived with a defective spirit level... it was empty! no liquid, and therefore no air bubble inside. It should be checked before shipping! For $53 it is not a cheap item and it is not expected to have any flaws!! Beside this small problem the product is very well made, heavy and sturdy and comes in a nice storage case.
customer_reviews.author: G. MOSIICI

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: a was looking for a good combination square for a good price and i highly recommend this product i was just what i was looking for
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tools are nice but don't have all the cutouts right to fit in the case properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason mollard

customer_reviews.title: Best I've seen in this price range
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the quality of castings and machine ground surfaces. Nice satin chrome ruler with easy to read graduations. Can't go wrong for the price if you ask me, way better than dealing with aluminum junk and stamped rulers while you save up for a high dollar set.
customer_reviews.author: Tools and stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after someone at work thought they needed my old one more than i did. Very well made, heavy duty and at a good price. I am a metal fabricator so the cheaper ones are not that accurate for what i do.
customer_reviews.author: Welder1

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: Used the set for awhile and have no complaints. Really works well and a great cost for what your getting. Even took the set to work to check out you how accurate it was on some of our quality equipment and it was just as good as a more expensive kit. Only complaint is the name is really pretty terrible, but what can you do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knob on square head broke off and plastic case warped upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Main reason for the one star is upon arrival the plastic case was warped and the little knob on top of the square head was snapped off.
customer_reviews.author: zaiax

customer_reviews.title: never again from this outfit
customer_reviews.text: the miter attachment is a total pain to attach--I couldn't imagine getting into a situation where I needed to repetitively remove and add the attachment. At first I couldn't figure out how to do it--it doesn't come with a manual, nor can one go to their website to download instructions, nor is their reference to a youtube video; what's more they include a a sticker espousing their commitment to quality with their customer service email address for one to contact them, which I did even attaching a photo of my problem and as of today, going on a month now, I haven't heard so much as a peep from them. Very poor--I recommend a name brand you can trust!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set up for the price - purchased for home use (leave my starrett set at work). Don't let people try to convince you these are starrett quality - they aren't. But for less than half the price, I think these are very nice and good enough for my home toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: iGaging Premium 4-Piece 12" 4R Combination Square
product_meta.description: This premium square features a 12 Inch blade, a cast iron center finding head, a cast iron 180 degree protractor head and a cast iron square/miter head with 45 degree and 90 degree precision ground faces. The adjustable heads may be locked securely in any position along the precision ground satin chrome finished steel blade. The protractor head can be moved in both directions. The blade features etched, machine divided graduations in 1/8 Inch and 1/16 Inch on one side and 1/32 Inch and 1/64 Inch on the other. The square/miter head incorporates a spirit level and hardened scriber. The square comes packaged in a padded plastic storage case.
feature_bullets: Fully Hardened and Tempered Steel Blade; Satin Chrome finish

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars102 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
